name: CreateNewLocation
description:
Create a new location for sales and configuration.

This tool creates a new location using the Square Locations API. It's useful for setting up separate configurations for receipt layouts, item prices, and sales reports. Ideal for developers integrating Square with their applications to manage distinct sales activities.

parameters.name: location_data
parameters.description: A JSON object containing the details for the location creation, including name, address, timezone, and other relevant settings.

id.description: A short generated string of letters and numbers that uniquely identifies this location instance.

name.description:
The name of the location.
This information appears in the Seller Dashboard as the nickname.
A location name must be unique within a seller account.

address_line_1.description:
The first line of the address.

Fields that start with `address_line` provide the address's most specific
details, like street number, street name, and building name. They do *not*
provide less specific details like city, state/province, or country (these
details are provided in other fields).

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address, if any.

address_line_3.description: The third line of the address, if any.

locality.description: The city or town of the address. For a full list of field meanings by country, see [Working with Addresses](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-addresses).

sublocality.description: A civil region within the address's `locality`, if any.

sublocality_2.description: A civil region within the address's `sublocality`, if any.

sublocality_3.description: A civil region within the address's `sublocality_2`, if any.

administrative_district_level_1.description:
A civil entity within the address's country. In the US, this
is the state. For a full list of field meanings by country, see [Working with Addresses](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-addresses).

administrative_district_level_2.description:
A civil entity within the address's `administrative_district_level_1`.
In the US, this is the county.

administrative_district_level_3.description:
A civil entity within the address's `administrative_district_level_2`,
if any.

postal_code.description: The address's postal code. For a full list of field meanings by country, see [Working with Addresses](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-addresses).

country.description:
Indicates the country associated with another entity, such as a business.
Values are in [ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 format](http://www.iso.org/iso/home/standards/country_codes.htm).

first_name.description: Optional first name when it's representing recipient.

last_name.description: Optional last name when it's representing recipient.

address.description:
Represents a postal address in a country. 
For more information, see [Working with Addresses](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-addresses).

timezone.description:
The [IANA time zone](https://www.iana.org/time-zones) identifier for
the time zone of the location. For example, `America/Los_Angeles`.

capabilities.description:
The Square features that are enabled for the location.
See [LocationCapability](entity:LocationCapability) for possible values.
See [LocationCapability](#type-locationcapability) for possible values

created_at.description:
The time when the location was created, in RFC 3339 format.
For more information, see [Working with Dates](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-dates).

merchant_id.description: The ID of the merchant that owns the location.

country.description:
Indicates the country associated with another entity, such as a business.
Values are in [ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 format](http://www.iso.org/iso/home/standards/country_codes.htm).

language_code.description:
The language associated with the location, in
[BCP 47 format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47#appendix-A).
For more information, see [Language Preferences](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/general-considerations/language-preferences).

currency.description:
Indicates the associated currency for an amount of money. Values correspond
to [ISO 4217](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217).

phone_number.description: The phone number of the location. For example, `+1 855-700-6000`.

business_name.description: The name of the location's overall business. This name is present on receipts and other customer-facing branding, and can be changed no more than three times in a twelve-month period.

website_url.description: The website URL of the location.  For example, `https://squareup.com`.

day_of_week.description: Indicates the specific day  of the week.

start_local_time.description:
The start time of a business hours period, specified in local time using partial-time
RFC 3339 format. For example, `8:30:00` for a period starting at 8:30 in the morning.
Note that the seconds value is always :00, but it is appended for conformance to the RFC.

end_local_time.description:
The end time of a business hours period, specified in local time using partial-time
RFC 3339 format. For example, `21:00:00` for a period ending at 9:00 in the evening.
Note that the seconds value is always :00, but it is appended for conformance to the RFC.

periods.description: The list of time periods during which the business is open. There can be at most 10 periods per day.

business_hours.description: The hours of operation for a location.

business_email.description: The email address of the location. This can be unique to the location and is not always the email address for the business owner or administrator.

description.description: The description of the location. For example, `Main Street location`.

twitter_username.description: The Twitter username of the location without the '@' symbol. For example, `Square`.

instagram_username.description: The Instagram username of the location without the '@' symbol. For example, `square`.

facebook_url.description: The Facebook profile URL of the location. The URL should begin with 'facebook.com/'. For example, `https://www.facebook.com/square`.

latitude.description: The latitude of the coordinate expressed in degrees.

longitude.description: The longitude of the coordinate expressed in degrees.

logo_url.description:
The URL of the logo image for the location. When configured in the Seller
Dashboard (Receipts section), the logo appears on transactions (such as receipts and invoices) that Square generates on behalf of the seller.
This image should have a roughly square (1:1) aspect ratio and should be at least 200x200 pixels.

pos_background_url.description: The URL of the Point of Sale background image for the location.

mcc.description:
A four-digit number that describes the kind of goods or services sold at the location.
The [merchant category code (MCC)](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/locations-api#initialize-a-merchant-category-code) of the location as standardized by ISO 18245.
For example, `5045`, for a location that sells computer goods and software.

full_format_logo_url.description:
The URL of a full-format logo image for the location. When configured in the Seller
Dashboard (Receipts section), the logo appears on transactions (such as receipts and invoices) that Square generates on behalf of the seller.
This image can be wider than it is tall and should be at least 1280x648 pixels.

eu_vat.description:
The EU VAT number for this location. For example, `IE3426675K`.
If the EU VAT number is present, it is well-formed and has been
validated with VIES, the VAT Information Exchange System.

fr_siret.description:
The SIRET (Système d'Identification du Répertoire des Entreprises et de leurs Etablissements)
number is a 14-digit code issued by the French INSEE. For example, `39922799000021`.

fr_naf.description:
The French government uses the NAF (Nomenclature des Activités Françaises) to display and
track economic statistical data. This is also called the APE (Activite Principale de l’Entreprise) code.
For example, `6910Z`.

es_nif.description:
The NIF (Numero de Identificacion Fiscal) number is a nine-character tax identifier used in Spain.
If it is present, it has been validated. For example, `73628495A`.

jp_qii.description:
The QII (Qualified Invoice Issuer) number is a 14-character tax identifier used in Japan.
For example, `T1234567890123`.

tax_ids.description: Identifiers for the location used by various governments for tax purposes.

An object containing the fields to POST for the request.

See the corresponding object definition for field details.
